issues.title: Unable to load commit diffs
issues.body:
Loading the diffs between commits aren't working for me.

The two errors I get on [this page](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/commit/?1P6tNJ97Hi1uUXjqpX3wJBUt4UFnAZojs6/31dbd041082205aab037c602df2d693ddc2993d3).

```
URIError: malformed URI sequence :   git.js:76:10

uncaught exception: File doesn't exist: merged-GitCenter/1P6tNJ97Hi1uUXjqpX3wJBUt4UFnAZojs6/torrent-share.git/objects/b0/211fc95dd8e9bc6d32dea35096e4b62f5fb2a1
```

Not entirely sure what it's passing to that method. Let me know if I can provide any more details.

issues.title: Feature Request: Show the opened date of issues and pull requests in the details
issues.body:
Although their shown on the issue and PR listing, they aren't still shown when you click on them, which prevents one from being able to get a timeline for when the PR was made to the comments thereafter.

Should be a small addition :)

issues.title: Place New Repository button on 'My Repos' page
issues.body: Seems natural that while looking at your repositories, that you'd be able to create a new one on the same page.

issues.title: Hide repo address on issue/PRs
issues.body:
Having the site address of the repo is a bit messy on the issue/PR page.

Perhaps remove the shown address and change the #123 to a link pointing to #123@1BxY9s...?

issues.title: Change "Username > Repo Name" to links
issues.body:
Force of habit from other Git sites lead me to believe that I can click `ivanq` above to get to your repository listings and `Git Center Source` to get back to the main page of the repository.

It would be nice to do the same here, of course only showing a black underline for the link when hovering.

issues.title: Click tag to filter
issues.body: When #1 is implemented, being able to click the tag of an existing issues, say `tag1`, should present you with all issues filtered by `tag1`.

issues.title: Have #123 link to issue/PR #123 in comments/commit messages
issues.body: When one writes #123 in a comment, it should turn into a link pointing to the referenced issue or comment. That issue/PR also gets a new "comment" posted that says what referenced it.

issues.title: Display how many comments an issue/PR has on the listings
issues.body: On the right of the lists, it would be nice if it had a "comment" icon with a number next to it specifying how many comments that issue/PR has.

issues.title: Display current repo in HTML page title
issues.body: Having lots of Git Center tabs open on different repos gets confusing when all the tabs have the same title of "Git Center - ZeroNet". I'm aware the " - ZeroNet" is appended automatically, so perhaps the title should just be set to the repo, so it will become "Git Center Source - ZeroNet".

issues.title: Messages in the comment timeline for when an issue/PR is closed/opened
issues.body:
It's useful to know at what point in a conversation an issue was opened or closed.

This fits in to #6 where you would display whether another issue has referenced this one. Ideally you could add an "information" item that can be appended to the comment stream that could hold this type of information.

issues.title: Display commits in the PR timeline
issues.body: Would have to cross-reference the comments date versus commit dates in the range between the first and last comment and figure out where to place commits related to that branch.

issues.title: Bug: Multiple issues have the same ID
issues.body:
It seems issue IDs are generated based on the page they're on, which leads to multiple issues having the same ID across different pages.

This is a bad bug :)

Testing Editing!

issues.title: Relative dates and times
issues.body:
Having dates and times such as "one day ago", "2 hours ago", "just now" while keeping the absolute date "Oct 30th" for times greater than a certain threshold (>30 days) would help to parse when things happened more quickly.

There are libraries available, but it is quite simple to do yourself: https://stackoverflow.com/a/7641812

issues.title: Unable to raise size limit on a repository
issues.body:
My ZeroHello currently reports the ZeroNet source code merger zite is running out of size. Typically I would click on the zite and confirm the notification to raise the size limit, however the page instantly redirects to the repo address on Git Center.

Either a way to raise the size from ZeroHello is needed or we need to check if such a notification is active before redirecting to Git Center.

issues.title: Comment previews
issues.body: Would be nice to be able to preview a comment before submitting it to the network, just to make sure we got all our markdown correct ;)

issues.title: Editing uses different font that original comment box
issues.body:
The editing feature is great! My only complaint is that it's a little strange to write up a comment in Helvetica font only to edit it a moment later in monospace.

Font should be kept consistent while editing :)

issues.title: Background for in-line `code` elements
issues.body:
It's currently a little hard to tell the difference between normal text and `inline code` in comments/issues etc. A light-grey background, similar to the one used for 

```
Muliline
code
```

would be great :)

issues.title: Cancel button after editing
issues.body:
After deciding to edit an issue, if I want to cancel there's no way to do so other than refreshing the page.

Perhaps stick a Cancel icon next to the Checkmark button which won't save changes, maybe with a "really cancel?" confirmation notification to avoid accidents :)

issues.title: 'No issues/Pull Requests yet' shown when there are no issues or PRs
issues.body:
Currently the Issues and PR pages look quite barren and/or a little broken when there are none yet: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/merged-ZeroMe/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/data/users/164x9q7LJPLX4SMbhqLPraKAGZRPa2gTFe/1513667057.jpg

It would be nice to show a little box below the Open/Close issues bar that simply says "No Issues yet." and "No Pull Requests yet" for the PRs page.

issue_comments.body: I have noticed that it loads diffs on other repos fine, but not the one linked above.

Just realized that the first comment *is* the issue/PR description... which is a little weird. Might want to changed `asd@asd.bit commented on` to `asd@asd.bit posted on` to the first comment to differentiate things a little?
Yes, this is a very handy feature that I use everyday at work. Would be nice to see here :)
Bonus points for UI popped up telling you in real time issues #121, #122, #123... when you start typing #12.
Displaying the issue ID on the listing would be useful as well.
Ah, interesting. So whenever linking to an issue/PR, you'd have to include the user's public address I assume?
So that number is not the repo's id, but the id of the user who posted it. Meaning when it's referenced, you need to include the number + the ID. Should still link though.
That's fine yeah. Maybe having it still be a copy-able link would be useful though?
^ Not the case on Github, so up to you.
Actually don't worry about constraining the timeline to first and last comment since commits could happen both before and after those.
Perfect!
Although get the JS error `day is not defined` in the console when going to the second page of issues :)
Looks good, yeah. The long ID is still fairly messy though... Maybe we could shorten them to the first 8 or so characters, just like we do for commit IDs? :D
Increasing limit in ZeroHello works wonderfully. Thanks!
Looks good to me, I can close it :P

Maybe there could just be a git-hook that inserts it into the PR flow after a commit is successful with the details of the commit? Only those merging would need to install it, though it would be a lot more work for the developer and make things inconsistent if one repo does it and another one does not.

Looks great, issues and all! Also just having "Git Center Source" at the top of the repo is cleaner, though it was useful to be able to click on the user who made the repo.

Edit: Looks like it came back :P
Likely because it's saving the count of stars in two different places? Shouldn't we just save the star count on the index and read from/write to that?
Looking great!
Good choice of icon!
Cleaner!
Looking fantastic :)

pull_request_comments.body: Yes, please sort issues by date. It's very confusing to make a new issue only to have it appear three pages back in the issue list :)
